summary: The term "EAC countries" refers to the member states of the East African Community, which includes Kenya, Uganda, Tanzania, Rwanda, Burundi, and South Sudan. In the context of EU legal and regulatory frameworks, these countries are significant for trade agreements and development cooperation. The EU engages with EAC countries to promote economic integration and sustainable development, facilitating regional cooperation and enhancing trade relations. Legal instruments such as partnership agreements and development aid frameworks are employed to support these objectives, ensuring compliance with EU standards and fostering economic growth within the EAC region.
